meanings.definition: Relating to or affected with tuberculosis.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with a tubercular infection.
meanings.sent2: She showed symptoms of a tubercular disease.
meanings.sent3: The tubercular bacteria threw a party in the lungs.
meanings.sent4: The tubercular clouds of smoke filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The tubercular nature of the illness was evident in the X-ray results.

meanings.definition: Characterized by the presence of tubercles.
meanings.sent1: The tubercular growth on the plant was concerning.
meanings.sent2: The skin condition appeared tubercular in nature.
meanings.sent3: The tubercular bumps on the road made the ride bumpy.
meanings.sent4: His tubercular thoughts spread like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The tubercular appearance of the skin was alarming.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or affected with tuberculosis.
meanings.sent1: The tubercular patient was isolated for treatment.
meanings.sent2: The tubercular outbreak caused panic in the community.
meanings.sent3: The tubercular cat refused to share its milk.
meanings.sent4: Her tubercular cough echoed through the room.
meanings.sent5: The tubercular history of the disease was well-documented.
